channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Abercrombie & Fitch soars more than 15% even as retailer slashes profit outlook due to tariffs
item.description: Abercrombie & Fitch's growth is slowing at its namesake brand and the company is expecting tariffs to reduce its earnings by $50 million.

item.title: Nvidia reports first-quarter earnings after the bell
item.description: There's one big question on many investor minds during this earnings call: China.

item.title: Goldman-backed Starling Bank reports 26% profit drop as it flags Covid loan fraud issue
item.description: British neobank Starling posted an annual profit before tax of £223.4 million, down nearly 26% year-on-year.

item.title: Dick's Sporting Goods stands by full-year guidance — even with tariffs looming
item.description: Dick's Sporting Goods reaffirmed its sales and profit guidance for fiscal 2025 and said the figures take into account all current tariffs in effect.

item.title: Macy's CEO says retailer will hike some prices as tariffs cut into profits
item.description: Macy's beat earnings estimates for the first quarter, but cut its 2025 profit outlook as tariffs complicate its turnaround strategy.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
item.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on ...

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.
